item.title: By: Auntie Ruth's Childminding
item.dc:creator: Auntie Ruth's Childminding
item.description:
Hi Michael
A great blog. I agree that all children should be accepted for who they are and not encouraged to be something they are uncomfortable with. Young children have only lived for such a short time. As an adult I feel my role is to celebrate every child for their uniqueness, and hopefully help them value and be content with themselves.
Kind regards
Ruth Denton

item.title: By: John Rice
item.dc:creator: John Rice
item.description: What a great introductory subject for your new blog, Michael. I quite agree and have long despaired at the negative connotations that have been attached to introverted children, not least within Early Learning Goals. Introverts are perhaps more cautious in nature, have a greater facility for self-reflection and a tendency to study a social situation before contributing. These are not negative traits; just a different way of being and behaving.
